page.title: 09Local History, Customs.
page.content: In Market Street, Dudly,there is a war memorial.The monument is a statue of a woman who stands upright, resting her hands on an anchor. She is dressed in a long flowing gown and wears a cloak with a hood. She has long hair which reaches her shoulders and has bare feet Below the statue are the names of those men from Dudley who lost their lives in the two world wars.There are 80 names altogether,58 from W.W.1 and 22 from W.W.2. It is made from soft marble.It was unveiled on Feb. 15,1923 by Mrs. Shaw-Storey who owned Arcot Hall and most of the land around Dudley.Each Armistice Day(Nov.11) those who survived the battles of the 2 wars attend a service at St. Paul's Church, then accompanied by Dudley Brass Band, they lay wreaths of poppies on the monument.
